abstract: co-expression networks and <mark class="highlighted">prenatal</mark> adversity conditions on cognitive <mark class="highlighted">development</mark> trajectories and gray matter
title: Cognitive Development and Brain Gray Matter Susceptibility to Prenatal Adversities: Moderation by the Prefrontal Cortex Brain-Derived Neurotrophic Factor Gene Co-expression Network
SCORE_JUSTIFICATION: The article title and abstract focus on cognitive development and prenatal adversities, but not specifically on cannabis exposure.
TYPE_JUSTIFICATION: The abstract pertains to the impact of prenatal adversities on cognitive development and brain gray matter, moderated by genetic factors. It seems to be a longitudinal study analyzing developmental trajectories.
METHODS: The study likely uses neuroimaging techniques and genetic analysis to assess brain gray matter and cognitive development in relation to prenatal adversities.
KEY_POINTS: Genetic moderation by brain-derived neurotrophic factor
BKT_JUSTIFICATION: The study provides insights into how genetic factors can moderate the impact of prenatal adversities on cognitive and brain development. It adds a nuanced understanding but does not represent a groundbreaking change in the field.
INCLUDE_JUSTIFICATION: While the study is relevant to prenatal influences on brain development, it does not focus on the specific effects of cannabis exposure.
